[ library(conjunto) | The ECLiPSe Libraries | Reference Manual | Alphabetic Index ]

lub(?S, ?Lub)

S is a set domain variable and Lub is the lower bound of its domain.
?S
A set domain variable.
?Lub
A free variable or a ground set.

Description

Lub is the ground set corresponding to the upper bound of the domain of S. If Lub is a free variable, it is instanciated to the upper bound of the domain of S. If it is a ground set, it should be equal to the upper bound of the domain of S, otherwise it fails.

Fail Conditions

Fails if S is not a set domain variable or if Lub is a ground set not equal to the upper bound of S domain.

Resatisfiable

No.

Examples

[eclipse 9]: S `:: {}.. {1,2,3,5}, lub(S,Lub).

S = S{{} .. {1, 2, 3}}
Lub = {1, 2, 3}
yes.

See Also

`:: / 2, glb / 2, set_range / 3
